snippet: A look at two hypothetical portfolios created last year: one anticipating President Obama’s re-election, another a Mitt Romney victory.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column looks at two hypothetical stock portfolios created by UBS analysts in 2012: one anticipating Pres Obama’s re-election, another a Mitt Romney victory; points out Obama portfolio gained 57.8 percent so far in 2013, and Romney's portfolio rose 32.2 percent; notes analysts credit Federal Reserve with helping market, even under Obama.
lead_paragraph: A look at two hypothetical portfolios created last year: one anticipating President Obama’s re-election, another a Mitt Romney victory.

headline.print_headline: Surprise in a Matchup of Presidential Stock Portfolios
headline.main: Surprise in a Matchup of Presidential Stock Portfolios

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
